webLinks.linkText: Georges River Council - In Good Taste markets

properties.headline: Local Markets - HURSTVILLE Forest Road at Macmahon Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The In Good Taste Night Markets will be taking place in Hurstville on Friday 4, 11 and 18 February from 4pm to 10pm. 

Th following roads will be closed from 10am until midnight each night: 

  • Forest Rd between Queens Rd and Macmahon St (Eastbound)
  • Forest Rd between Macmahon St and Woodville St
  • Macmahon St between Forest Rd and Dora St

Special event clearways will also be in place on these roads from 10am until midnight each night. 

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual on roads in the area including King Georges Rd, Queens Rd and Railway Pde during the event.

  • Forest Rd Between Queens Rd and Macmahon St (Eastbound)

  • Macmahon St Between Forest Rd and Dora St

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Summer Streets on Crown Street

properties.headline: Summer Streets event - SURRY HILLS Crown Street between Cleveland St AND Foveaux Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Summer Streets - Surry Hills road closures and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Summer Streets - Surry Hills road closures and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Summer Streets event on Crown St. The event runs from 11am until 9pm. 

Roads will be closed from 9am until 10:30pm including Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St, and sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, High Holborn St, Jesson Lane, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers Lane.

Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Baptist St, Cleveland St, Chalmers St, Randle St, Elizabeth St and Albion St. Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Rainford St and Withers Lane. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SURRY HILLS

FROM 9AM TO 10:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St 3 between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St 2 between Bourke St and Crown St
  • Devonshire St 3 between Wilshire St and Crown St (Westbound)
  • High Holborn St 1 between Lansdowne St and Miles Ss
  • Jesson Ln from Jesson St
  • Jesson St from Crown St
  • Lansdowne St between High Holborn St and Crown St
  • Miles St 2 between Crown St and High Holborn St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln between Withers Pl and Crown St

Notes:

  • 1 Resident Access permitted
  • 2 Resident Access permitted - contraflow arrangements will be in effect under traffic control
  • 3 Light rail corridor at Devonshire St to remain open at all times

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 10:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln between Withers Pl and Crown St

webLinks.linkText: Sun Run 2022 - TfNSW interactive road closure & clearway map

properties.headline: Sun Run 7km and 10km events - DEE WHY, CURL CURL, FRESHWATER, QUEENSCLIFF, MANLY The Strand, Griffin Road, North Steyne & South Steyne
properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert while roads are closed along the course. Visit transportnsw.info for more info and to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sun Run 2022 - Road closures, changed access and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sun Run 2022 - Road closures, changed access and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sun Run 7km and 10km fun run events will start at 6:15am from The Strand in Dee Why and finish by 9:30am at South Steyne in Manly. Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect. All roads will re-open by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

Road closures:

  • Dee Why - 3.30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde. Crossover maintained on Oaks Ave at The Strand eastbound until 5:15am and westbound until 6am. 
  • Curl Curl to Freshwater - 5:30am to 9am: Griffin Rd, Pitt Rd, Abbott Rd, Carrington Pde and local surrounding roads will be closed. Crossover maintained on Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde in both directions and on Playfair Rd, Ross Rd at Pitt Rd until 6am. 
  • Queenscliff - 5.30am to 10am: sections of Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd, Dowling St, Lumsdaine Dr and surrounding local roads. Crossover maintained westbound (exit only) on Crowd Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am-6:15am and 9am-10am. 
  • Manly - 3.30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads. Managed access for Cameron Ave residents from 5.30am-9am.
  • Manly - 3.30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3:30am until 9am along sections of roads in Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly including sections of Abbott Road, Howard Avenue, The Strand, Evans Street, Crown Road and North Steyne.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

  • The Strand between Dee Why Pde and Oaks Ave both sides

QUEENSCLIFF

MANLY

From 3:30am to 9am

  • North Steyne between The Corso and Raglan St western side
  • South Steyne between The Corso and Ashburner St eastern side
  • South Steyne between Victoria Pde and The Corso western side

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Lunar Festival

properties.headline: Sydney Lunar Festival - HAYMARKET Harbour Street, Hay Street, Sussex Street at Chinatown

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney Lunar Festival 2022 - road closures & clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney Lunar Festival 2022 - road closures & clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Sydney Lunar Festival – Lunar Lanes in Chinatown from 5pm until 10pm. 

Road closures will be in place from 12pm Saturday until 1am Sunday on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St, Little Pier St, Kimber Lane, Sussex St and Factory St. 

Access for residents, businesses and hotel guests will be managed by traffic controllers on site on Goulburn St at Harbour St and Sussex St intersections.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 10am Saturday until 1am Sunday on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St and Sussex St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the direction of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:

FROM 12PM MIDDAY SATURDAY, 29 JANUARY 2022 TO 1:00AM SUNDAY, 30 JANUARY 2022

ROAD CLOSURES WITH MANAGED ACCESS

  • Harbour Street between Goulburn Street and Little Hay St
  • Little Pier Street between Tumbalong Boulevard and Harbour Street
  • Sussex Street between Goulburn Street and 410 Sussex Street

Access for residents, businesses and hotel guests will be managed by traffic controllers on site on Goulburn St at Harbour St and Sussex St intersections.

  • Factory Street between Harbour Street and Dixon Street

  • Sussex Street between 410 Sussex Street & Hay Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

FROM 10AM SATURDAY 29 JANUARY UNTIL 1AM SUNDAY 30 JANUARY

  • Harbour Street between Hay Street and Goulburn Street

  • Sussex Street between Goulburn Street and Hay Street

properties.headline: NBL match - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Perth Wildcats at Qudos Bank Arena, Flames V Southside from 12.30pm, Kings V Wildcats from 3pm until around 5.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: A-League - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Turton Road
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header - Newcastle Jets v Adelaide United at McDonald Jones Stadium. Women's Kick off from 4.05pm, Men's kick off from 6.45 and full time 8.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Soccer Match - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men- Sydney FC v Central Coast Mariners at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 4:05pm, full time at 5:45pm approx. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Central Coast Mariners at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7.45pm and full-time around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium.

properties.headline: Cricket match - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: SCO_1080_MOORE PARK WALK_17DEC21_V017 NO SHUTTLES OR EP2.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
Twenty20 International: Australia v Sri Lanka at the SCG. Play starts from 7.10pm, finish around 10.20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Fans can access the EP3 Southern grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will not be open for the game.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight on sections of Lang Road, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Fans can access the EP3 Southern grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will not be open for the game.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight on sections of Lang Road, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: Triathlon - TOMAKIN George Bass Drive and North Head Drive
properties.otherAdvice:
The Batemans Bay Triathlon Festival is taking place in Tomakin from 10am until 2:30pm. 

Road closures will be in place from 10am until 3:30pm approx. on the following roads: 

  • George Bass Dr between Broulee Rd and North Head Dr 
  • North Head Dr between George Bass Dr and Princes Hwy

Controlled access will also be in place on George Bass Dr between Sunpatch Pde, Tomakin and Train Street, Broulee, and between Train St and Broulee Rd. 

Motorists should exercise caution while travelling in the area as participants are running and cycling on roads. Residential access will be maintained during the closure period.

roads.mainStreet: George Bass Drive and North Head Drive

properties.headline: A-League - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western United at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm, full time around 9:45pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

webLinks.linkText: Newcastle Caravan, Camping and Lifestyle Expo

properties.headline: Expo - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Chatham Road
properties.otherAdvice:
The Newcastle Caravan, Camping and Lifestyle Expo will be taking place at Newcastle Entertainment Centre and Showground from Friday 4 February to Sunday 6 February, 9am until 5pm daily. 

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Griffths Rd between 9am and 5pm during the event as crowds make their way to the event. The right hand turn lane from Griffith Rd into the venue may be restricted during the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Comedy Show - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sooshi Mango: Off The Boat show at Qudos Bank Arena from 7.30pm until around 9.40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race from 12:20pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: Music Festival - POKOLBIN McDonalds Road at Broke Road
properties.otherAdvice:
SummerSalt Music Festival is taking place at the Roche Estate in the Hunter Valley from 1pm to 10pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Wine Country Dr, McDonalds Rd and Broke Rd approaching the site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity. The intersection of Wine Country Dr and Broke Rd will be under traffic management and a 40km/h speed limit will be in place. 

Attendees using the Hunter Expressway can exit at the Branxton Interchange and use Wine Country Dr and then either McDonalds Rd or Broke Rd to access the event.

properties.headline: Super Rugby Trial Match - BURRADOO Wirreanda Road at Eridge Park Road
properties.publicTransport: Buses will run between Moss Vale, Mittagong and Bowral to the venue, pre-purchased tickets are required. Visit Bowral Rugby Club for more information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby Trial Match Waratahs v Brumbies at Eridge Park, Bowral Rugby Club. Gates open 1pm, preliminary games kick off from 2pm and 3pm, Waratahs v Brumbies kick off from 5.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Eridge Park Rd and Moss Vale Rd as attendees travel to and from the event throughout the day. 

Allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
